title: Ecofriendly Sun Care Brand VitaSea Launches E-Commerce Website with Five Sustainable Products for Sensitive Skin - PR Newswire
summary: VitaSea, a new sun care brand, has launched its e-commerce website with a line of five hero sun care products made for those with an active, outdoor lifestyle and an appreciation for environmental conservation. VitaSea products are formulated with sustainable and biodegradable ingredients, and are hypoallergenic, dermatologist-tested, and suitable for even the most sensitive skin, while offering a pleasant sensorial experience with a naturally-derived, quintessential ocean fragrance. VitaSea is committed to bringing awareness and resources to the most urgent environmental concerns of our time, and as a member of 1% for the Planet, is committed to offering premium sun care products, while promoting conservation and supporting environmental issues that will reduce and offset CO2 emissions.
green_innovation: TRUE, VitaSea's sun care products are formulated with sustainable and biodegradable ingredients, and are hypoallergenic, dermatologist-tested, and suitable for even the most sensitive skin, while offering a pleasant sensorial experience with a naturally-derived, quintessential ocean fragrance.
business_innovation: TRUE, VitaSea's sun care products offer a new combination of sustainable and biodegradable ingredients, and are hypoallergenic, dermatologist-tested, and suitable for even the most sensitive skin, while offering a pleasant sensorial experience with a naturally-derived, quintessential ocean fragrance.
green_product: TRUE, VitaSea's sun care products are formulated with sustainable and biodegradable ingredients, and are hypoallergenic, dermatologist-tested, and suitable for even the most sensitive skin.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a process.

title: Ready-To-Drink Beverage Start-Up Salud Plans Foray Into 10 Indian Markets - Outlook Startup
summary: Alco-bev brand Salud Beverages is expanding into 10 new Indian markets and launching new Ready-to-Drink (RTD) products, including a premium gin and Salud bitters. The company is also investing $1.5 million to fuel growth in the Indian alco-beverage market, where the RTD market is projected to grow at an 11.2 per cent CAGR from 2022-2030. Salud is committed to environmental sustainability, using recyclable cans for its products and sourcing and producing everything locally.
green_innovation: TRUE, Salud Beverages is committed to environmental sustainability, using recyclable cans for its products and sourcing and producing everything locally.
business_innovation: TRUE, Salud is expanding its product range by introducing three stock-keeping units (SKUs) based on distinct spirits, catering to a broader range of consumer preferences.
green_product: TRUE, Salud Beverages uses recyclable cans for its products, which are made from aluminum, a material that can be recycled repeatedly without losing its properties.
green_process: TRUE, Salud Beverages sources and produces everything locally, which reduces its carbon footprint.
product_or_process: Salud is expanding its product range by introducing three stock-keeping units (SKUs) based on distinct spirits, catering to a broader range of consumer preferences.

title: Diageo India Introduces Godawan Century, a Limited-Edition Artisanal Single Malt, Celebrating the Great Indian Bustard - PR Newswire
summary: Diageo India, the country's leading beverage company, introduced Godawan Century, a bespoke 100-bottles-batch of limited-edition Single Malt, that pays homage to the Great Indian Bustard. The brand is working wholeheartedly for the environmental conservation and ecological preservation of the bird. The launch of Godawan Century showcased the brand's dedication to mindful luxury and the efforts to create a positive impact on society and the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, Godawan Century is a product of a green innovation as it is designed to conserve an endangered species.
business_innovation: TRUE, Godawan Century is a business innovation as it is a new product for the company.
green_product: FALSE, Godawan Century is not a green product.
green_process: FALSE, Godawan Century is not a green process.

title: Founders of Lifelong Online Retail Acquire Majority Ownership and Control, Expanding Focus on Indian Market - Indian Retailer
summary: Juicy Chemistry and Mommy Shots by Amrita have launched the 'Scars Are Beautiful' campaign in honor of Women's Day to promote body positivity and self-love among mothers. The campaign features 11 mothers who proudly display their postpartum bodies and stretch marks, challenging societal beauty standards. By embracing their "tiger stripes," these women aim to inspire others to redefine beauty, promote inclusivity, and celebrate the unique experiences of motherhood.
green_innovation: TRUE. The campaign promotes body positivity and the acceptance of postpartum bodies, which contributes to environmental sustainability by challenging conventional beauty standards.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not describe a new or improved product or business process for one or more business functions, but rather a marketing and social media campaign.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe a new or improved good or service that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a new or improved business process that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: ['541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services', '561990 - All Other Support Services', '541890 - Other Advertising Services', '561312 - Beauty Salons']
greenwashing: FALSE. The campaign is not an example of greenwashing as it genuinely promotes body positivity and inclusivity, empowering women to embrace their bodies and reject unrealistic beauty standards.

title: The richest people in Vancouver, listed - Cantech Letter
summary: Fortunes have been made in Vancouver through a variety of industries, including real estate, technology, resource extraction, and retail. Several notable entrepreneurs and investors have built profitable businesses and accumulated wealth in the city, contributing to its diverse economy.
